page.title: 04FOWLIS EASTER VILLAGE CONT.
page.content: There is a disused corn mill adjacent to a stream from which it obtained power.The condition of the mill is now poor and major renovation is required. The landscape is one typical of the whole area. Fields with cash crops being the main land covering. Only 28 people inhabit the village 40% of whom are of retiral age or over. The approaches to the village are impressive with the Castle and the Church particularly dominant features. Within the Village the winding road presents a constantly changing sequence of views and all the buildings are set against the densely wooded Fowlis Den.
